column1: #Text=The dive site Miracle Waters is an inland dive site in the ( locality name ) area on the ( topographical feature ) , near Brits in the North West Province of South Africa .
#Text=The site is fresh water in an abandoned mine at high altitude ( ? m )

#Text=This lake is used primarily as a training location for Johannesburg-based Open Water diver training schools , along with Bass Lake , however it is also a popular recreational diving destination for those who live within a few hours ' drive .
#Text=An entrance fee is charged to divers .
#Text=10km NW of Hartebeespoort Dam , about 90km NW of Johannesburg
#Text=This site is not in a Marine Protected Area .
#Text=Visibility is moderate , from 10 metres down to 5 or less after much diving during the day when divers kick up the silt .
#Text=Visibility may be better in winter when there is less diving activity .
#Text=Miracle Waters is a flooded chromium mine with approximately 6 hectare surface area .
#Text=This is an inland site and not greatly affected by weather and season .
#Text=Water is fairly warm ( up to 24째C in summer ) , however there are several noticeable thermoclines at approximately 12 , 17 , and 21 metres .
#Text=In winter the water will be colder .
#Text=The water is very still , with no waves .
#Text=Air temperatures may drop below 0째C at night in winter , and may reach 38째C during the day in summer
#Text=Air and Nitrox fills are available on site
#Text=There is a restaurant , ablution facilities , and a number of lapas available to divers .
#Text=Camping is permitted , however the main gate is locked overnight .
#Text=There is a large tree-shaded picnic area with tables and benches .
#Text=Take the N4/Bekwena Highway west towards Rustenburg/Brits .
#Text=Exit by the second Brits off ramp .
#Text=Turn right at the stop and drive over the highway to the next 4-way stop street ( past the John Deere agency )
#Text=Turn left at the 4-way stop and drive for about 2 km until you reach the sign for Miracle Waters on the left .
#Text=Turn right at the sign and continue to the water .
#Text=Bass and Kurper , and a freshwater crab may be seen
#Text=There are several grids in various locations
#Text=Various other items , including a computer workstation
#Text=You must set your decompression computer to the correct altitude range or use altitude tables to avoid increased risk of decompression sickness .
#Text=No special skills are required , the site is suitable for entry level diver training .
#Text=Back to Diving inland in South Africa
